Summary Heading: Super good quality and good value
Summary: This place is wonderful. Super clean, super good value for the money. The staff here is super friendly, Evie at the front desk is always contagiously happy and super helpful. Have stayed at a bunch of places in Irvine and keep coming back to this one because its the best option, hands down. 10/10 would Sonesta again
Manager Response: Dear Romteinr,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! we are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon. Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Courtyard by another name, is still a Courtyard
Summary: I had grown accustomed (pre Covid) with staying in the Courtyard Marriott, and had tried to book at this location(June 2021) only to find that another company had purchased many of the Courtyards from Marriott. [Told to me by the very helpful front desk] Sonesta is a family owned hotel chain, found primarily east of the Mississippi River that have been in business for over 60 years.  With these purchases, they have expanded their brand to cover a larger area than before, including the Western US.  I decided to give them a try, and was not disappointed. In fact it would be easy to say, except for the new branding...you are left feeling like you are still in a Courtyard.  Now with that in mind, let's get to a few details.  This property is an easy freeway off, freeway on location.
Room tip: I got a room facing away from freeway thinking that it would be pretty quiet (and it was).

Summary: This hotel is definitely not a 3-star hotel. The hotel has dirty hallways our room had a musty smell to it and we found hairs on the bed and in the bathroom floor. Found some black spots on the ceiling of the bathroom curtains were filthy definitely disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Jesslo3135,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, I can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great hotel experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Run down and over priced!!  Unprofessional housekeeping manager
Summary: Horrible housekeeping manager!!!  Beware of many horrible experiences if you book here.  Run down rooms.  Charge $3.00 for a cup of coffee in the morning, no housekeeping.  I asked after 5 nights to have my room cleaned.  The housekeeping manager was rude beyond belief telling me that I should have asked a day ahead of time if I wanted my room cleaned.    She stated they did not have time to clean my room….  After 5 nights!!???!!!

The desk lamp was really dim, and I squinted my eyes the entire time while typing. This is not good. Also, the sliding door fails to lock properly. Worried for my safety. Their towels looked gross, and I had to switch rooms, but the problem remains. There appears to be an odor in the room from the carpet? They didn't provide details on how to access WIFI. Had to contact Front Desk. The Front Desk is very helpful in answering all questions. Doesn't provide lotion. Overall, I would say my experience is a mixed bag. The lack of lighting, because I think they're trying to save money is horrible. Need more lighting. I would give it 2.5/5, because the sliding door doesn't lock, and lighting. Everything else can be tolerated. Could use some improvement with management and cleanliness.

As about me, I was perfectly happy with this hotel. My room had a balcony and I enjoyed sleeping with open doors and fresh air. It was great. Noise from the highway was constant. But, with the closed doors, you will be fine. I did not use any other of their services, cannot comment on those. But, sleep was great. Thank you very much!

My husband and I were very satisfied with staying at the Courtyard but our last visit was very upsetting. My husband and I were BOTH charged on our credit cards for the two night stay, I was so angry. I called to have them reverse one charge and they were not accommodating at all. Now my husband and I both have to get bank statements from our bank to prove their error, This is our last stay at the Courtyard in Laguna Hills.

Front desk clerk would not accept cash, unless I paid another $300 for incidentals.  I always pay cash at check in and leave a credit card for incidentals.  She advised that the new assistant manager would not accept this and there would be no exceptions.  I have stayed at this hotel MANY times in the past but there are too many other nice, newer hotels I will check into the next time.  This Courtyard is getting old and they are now drving away business.  In addition, the jacuzzi was not working as the switch was broken off.  The assistant manager should open her eyes!
Manager Response: Hello M2967HErobertw,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. I apologize about the issue with Jacuzzi, and for falling short of meeting your expectations.  I will let the appropriate department know and fix if needed. Unfortunately the Marriott Policy for cash paying guest is to receive payment upfront for the room and tax plus a security deposit for incidental. You are welcome at the hotel and we would like your business but unfortunately we can not make any exceptions when it comes to payment procedures.  Again thank you for your feedback and hope to serve you, in the future.  Regards, Marina Tanagho Assistant General Manager. Courtyard Laguna Hills

Summary: Over 150 nights a year in hotels - this Courtyard may in fact be the least enjoyable Marriott worldwide.  If your looking for convenience to Irvine and a mattress - maybe ok, this is your place.   If you need customer service, well run hotel, working plugs... stay at any another Marriott or just across the freeway at the new Hilton Gardens.
Manager Response: Dear JustSayingDD,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. My name is MARINA TANAGHO I and I am the Assistant General  Manager at the Courtyard Laguna Hills Irvine Spectrum/Orange County. It has come to my attention that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone anytime at 949-859-5500. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Courtyard Laguna Hills Irvine Spectrum/Orange County.  Sincerely,  Marina Tanagho ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER 949.859.5500   COURTYARD LAGUNA HILLS 23175 AVENIDA DE LA CARLOTA LAGUNA HILLS, CA 92653

Summary: The hotel is easy to find and there is a lot of parking which is nice for the area. The person who assisted with check-in with in training, so naturally she was super friendly and put her best effort. The same can't be said for the team working at the in-house Starbuck's cafe. The guy was slow, sourly and unenthusiastic.  Anyways, I had a room on the first floor. I didn't mind that at first, but at night it was awful. I could hear doors slamming, the side door to the parking lot opening/closing plus street traffic. I heard a couple arguing right outside my door near the main lobby too.  I mean, at least the room was clean parking was free! Due to the fact that I had to be somewhere at 8 AM the next day and only got 4-5 hours of sleep - I give this place a low rating. I expect to
Manager Response: Hello JayeCA,  Thank you so much for your feedback, I have shared it with the team to understand the importance of delivering exceptional service with enthusiasm.    I apologize for the noise that you encountered I wish you had informed us while staying to make it right and transfer you to a much quitter room.  Thank you for staying with us and hope to serve you again in the future.  Regards, Marina Tanagho Assistant General Manager.

Summary: Only a quick one night stay but it has been very good and fuss free.  The good: - All staff that I encountered were friendly and helpful. No problems with the service here. - Rooms were clean and beds comfortable enough. Not the most modern rooms but totally fine for a short stay.  Things to look out for: - I had a room that faced the freeway and there was some noise from vehicles passing. It wasn’t overly noticeable but I can imagine those who are more sensitive to noise having issues.  I’m writing from the perspective of a Marriott plat. There was no noticeable upgrade but they did put me in a room on the highest floor (I guess that’s sort of an upgrade) and they are heavily booked as well.

We booked another Courtyard hotel nearby for the night since we both live an hour away from the area, and needed to find a place to stay for the night for work, and was disappointed that when I sent my husband to check in, we were told they were fully booked for the night, and sent him here.  He unfortunately was given a 1st floor room facing the driveway, which I hate for privacy reasons.  I always wanted a higher floor with a view.  The staff also is clueless, since my husband already told him to expect for me, and to have my guest card ready.  He did not know what I was talking about when I came in.  The crowd was mostly business crowd, and the pool area was already closed for the night when I checked in.  The lobby is okay, and/but would never pick this hotel again for

I had a 2 nite stay for business. The general manager (unfortunately didn't get her name) checked me in with a brand new employee. They gave me dice to roll for extra points which was great and offered a drink for the wait. The room was very clean. It overlooked the freeway but with double sliding doors I wasn't bothered by the noise. I also used the very clean workout room with free weights, treadmills etc. There was a variety for breakfast and I also had a very good glass of wine. I had hoped to use the pool but it was raining during my free time. There is ample free parking. The hotel can be difficult to find as rather by itself in a corporate area. There appear to be repeat business guests and I would recommend it.

This hotel is tucked in a location out of nowhere, but it’s fine. What makes it a lot worse is the attitude of the front desk. I checked in on a day it’s mostly empty, the guy gave me the room that’s closest to the freeway.  He also had a very bad attitude during the whole check in process. When I asked if they have bottled water, he pointed to the market place telling me I could purchase one.  I travel very often and I am just amazed how bad the service is, because I hadn’t run into situations like this for a very long time.   Stayed on 5/10/2019, I think this front desk guy should probably work somewhere else if he’s so unhappy.

We went to this hotel because the hotel we were actually planning on staying at ended up not being a positive location, so we chose this place due to the proximity of the initial hotel location and I'm so glad that we did! Every single front staff desk member that I came into contact with was absolutely superior. They all were friendly, patient, congenial, and do their best to make sure all their guests were accounted for, letting waiting guests know that they would be attended to shortly, as soon as they were finished with the guest they were with at the time. The wait was never long and, as I said before, all the front desk staff members were phenomenal. The only issue we came across was a slightly disgruntled food service employee who didn't want to take our breakfast order,

This hotel has amazing staff! from the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff, everyone is friendly and accommodating! The lobby has nice seating areas for friends and family to gather. There is a small coffee, bar and food area, run by the hotel staff and offering basic items. There is a seating area with a fire pit outside separate from the pool area that also offers a nice place to hang out. The pool is nothing special, but there are both lounge chairs and a table with chairs. The rooms themselves are very basic and what you would expect from a Courtyard. Some of the upper floors have balconies, but no chairs and really too small to sit on. There is a refrigerator but no microwave (which I always find a bit annoying). The room and bathroom were cleaned well.

I have stayed here twice now. This hotel is a straight up business hotel. No frills, nothing outside of the standard business hotel ambiance. It is clean, it is efficient, and the service is friendly to the extend as expected from a business hotel. Note that this hotel is immediately adjacent to the I-5 freeway. When making a reservation, be sure to request a room facing away from the freeway as this will reduce some of the extreme noise from the passing traffic. There is no restaurant inside of the hotel, but the breakfast counter serves some meals as part of their evening service. There is no breakfast included with a stay here, but the bar serves Starbucks coffee and has a breakfast a la cart menu available. Be prepared for long waits for a cup of coffee in the morning. Staff

The outside of this hotel looks a little dated but when you walk into the lobby they have updated it. The staff is very nice here so the average rating is just how it looks in general outside and a few other room issues.  I arrived into the room which looked remodeled. The balcony itself was definitely in need of some tlc. The room had ants crawling on the walls of the bedroom as well as in the bathroom. It was so late and I was too tired to take care of it so I just hope they wouldn’t crawl all over me during the night. I called the front desk in the morning before leaving for the day and he immediately said he would take care of it. I came back and there were no ants to be seen so issue remedied.

Have a car, because there is nothing within walking distance.  Lots of parking, and easy to find off the highway.  Great staff, large rooms, and good bar service in the lobby.  Pool was always busy.  Hate not having to sign into a the internet service....

+ Check-in/check-out service quick and easy + Double room of sufficient size with working area + Toilet also of good size  + Microwave near the reception + Good WiFi connection - No safe; you can deposit items at the reception  - This is so far the only hotel ever worldwide that did not respond to my request for assistance in renting out a wheelchair. When I called to follow up, the response was in the direction of "why would you expect us to help you with this; can't you google"? - carpeted rooms and do not provide slippers - there is a receptionist with a flower in her hair, who seems not to comprehend what you are saying immediately. Perhaps not fit for divergent clientele

The hotel is “okay”. We had a few ants in our room.  The bathroom had a sewer smell, it’s close to a busy freeway so their is road noise. It is lower priced and about 30-45 minutes to Laguna Beach.  We rented two rooms because our adult children were with us. The restaurant in the hotel is fairly good but pricey for the type of food. It’s convenient so that’s nice!

They speak Spanish and they are. pleasant the help to assist with towels and linen for the beds. Just ask if they speak Spanish. The front desks are very pleasant the drive to Dana point and pacific highway drive is pretty close. You also have mission viejo and lake forest near by with good Mexican food and late night snacks

The hotel has done some remodeling, but it still shows its age, the lobby is pretty nice, and the rooms seemed pretty cramped, not what I’m used to from this brand.  Not sure if I’d stay here again, lots of choices nearby

The hotel was clean and had ample parking, but what could have been better is the bathroom tubs have nothing to prevent your feet from slipping, breakfast options misleading from websites . They are an option you pay for  (calling breakfast included), but when you do , it confirms 1 breakfast paid for, misleading if you are traveling with a spouse or family. The selections were limited and made to order. Finally, called lobby for 7:00 am wake up call, and they didn’t follow through.

Summary Heading: Room Reeked of Cigarettes and Double Charged Me!
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE, THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY! Arrived Thanksgiving evening at 7pm, got to our room and it absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. So nasty, couldn't imagine sleeping in the room without having all our belongings smell. Called the front desk, she offered to put us in a different room down the hall. Nothing much to report, check out the next day. Didn't make any purchase or eat there and left at 8am. However, I look at my credit card statement and find they charged me for the room! I paid via Expedia but the hotel charged me too. I spent 90 minutes with Expedia, they called the Hotel and insisted it was for "incidentals" sorry but what could possibly cost $123.08 at their hotel, there's no spa or services! The hotel could not tell me what these charges were for

Can’t beat the location close to everything a older property but well maintained convenient on site food available . You can get alcohol but there really is not a bar per se. .  Small exercise room however the clientele doesn’t seem to use it much so it is available shop the rates since they can vary greatly.

Summary Heading: Clean room and easy internet access
Summary: We would have given five for the cleanness and the friendly staff in the front desk, Mike , but while we had requested a quiet room away from Highway, we ended up with a room right next to it.   The room was clean and nice ... we just spent 2 nights here so everything seems fine except the noise level

Hotel was fine.  I was surprised the room I got was  in the back and i am a lifetime Plat Plus member.  Room was good size and clean.  The staff was friendly as expected.  The location is okay and it can be a little noisy because of the highway right there.  The staff at the eatery in the hotel was very nice.  The price was an issue as Mon it was $175'ish and Tues it jumped to $245'ish.  Crazy.

Very noisy near the highway. Dated rooms With noisy air conditioners. Decor and carpeting is tired and dated. Cheap - probably due to the quality of the hotel. Small fitness room - but fitness equipment was modern.

I was there for my brothers "celebration of life" events in Laguna. I picked this hotel first because of it being a Marriott property and secondly, the location to Laguna Woods where my father of 96 lives. This Courtyard was very quiet, clean and as usual, had very accommodating Associates. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone looking for a great location and a very friendly and professionally managed property.

Location near the freeway is good if you're staying here in order to visit somewhere locally, otherwise it's a bit odd. Rooms are spacious, but quite dated and old. Lobby area is ok though the bar and coffee area is not staffed during the day. Basically a decent place for a quick stop on your way somewhere or to visit friends / family in the area.

Stayed recently with family. Convenient to freeways. Within an hour of many attractions - ferrys, beaches, theme parks, hiking, UC Irvine, OC Great Park, etc. Small issue with front desk as we made reservations in a room block for two nights, and added a third. Initially told we could keep same room; then first morning as we were leaving to catch a ferry told we'd need to move our stuff. Staff eventually gave us the ok to stay in same room but were reluctant to do so. Learned lesson - get message in in system when making reservation; clarify and get staff name when checking in! Room clean, nice AM and PM bistro.  Would stay again.

The room was very clean! That is probably the most important thing to me. I would have given it a 5 if there was a restaurant close to it. We ate dinner at the little bar they have. It was fine. They have a few decent options. Everyone was nice.

This hotel is great for a quick stay whether for business or pleasure. It's convenient right off of interstate 5. Hiking isn't far and is off the 133, as well as a yummy Burger Lounge in los Olivos mall nearby.  There is a Starbucks on premise that has specific hours as well. I'll be back.

Stayed here 3 nights, while in town on business. The property is conveniently located near many restaurants, and it has easy access to the freeway. The property itself is well maintained, both inside and out.  The staff is very friendly and professional.  I had a first floor room near the side exit, which made for an easy in or out of the hotel.  As a Platinum for Life/Platinum Premier status holder, I would recommend this property highly.

I booked my stay for three nights and left after one. The hotel is on a random area right next to the freeway with an awkward entrance. The lobby is remodeled to Courtyard standards, but the rooms were not. This Courtyard seemed to have done the minimal remodeling efforts (poor lighting, bad design, popcorn textured ceilings, bad wallpaper/paint jobs) and the rooms (especially the King) were small.   The staff was on one hand pleasant and on the other hand rude at the same time. Both front desk agents (I was passed off because one was over time and needed to leave) became easily annoyed and frustrated by simple common hospitality requests (especially when most of my preferences are already linked to my rewards account). If I had the patience and wasn't so tired, I would have

Probably my worst Marriott experience ever. Front desk staff was not friendly upon check-in. There was an issue with our booking and I was okay with the changes. Only thing that bothered me was how the person at the front desk approached my situation. Very cold and unwelcoming. We had a long day of travels and at this point we were not going to look around for a hotel at 11pm. We were placed on the 2nd floor directly near the elevator and we could hear noise from the washing machines near by. We were in and out of the hotel most of our stay, and from the service we had received upon check-in we didn't want to bother asking to switch rooms. The following couple days we also noticed that we were overcharged and when I asked the front desk as to why we were over charged the agent

Good and safe hotel. Very close to the freeway. Good and friendly service by the front desk. Rooms were neat and clean. There is a 24 hrs small  marketplace for getting eatables and drinks. We stayed in a king bedroom. Felt the room was bit congested. Otherwise everything else was fine.

Loved this hotel so much! By far one of the nicest hotels because of the area the hotel was located in, the workers in the hotel and the super easy check in! Super clean! Super Friendly definitely recommend!

The hotel is well priced for the area. It is getting old but it is clean. The beds are comfortable , rooms have enough space. The staff at the reception is friendly and helpful. The only problem of my stay was the fact that room cleaning service arrived past 3 pm when they had from 7 am to 3 pm to clean the room. So I had to vacate the room for them to clean when I had work to do to finish my day! They need to organize their cleaning service
Manager Response: Thank you Robert for staying with us and for your comments.  Please know that our housekeeping department works from 8am until 5pm each day. For your future reference we are happy to clean the room anytime during the day.  Just let the front desk know the best time for our housekeepers to get into your room and we will make sure it is clean when you return.    We look forward to serving you again the next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Late night decision to stay - but these guys are great!
Summary: I got here at the Courtyard around 9:00.  It was a late night  decision to stay here, but when I got to the hotel I received a lot of help from the front desk.  Her name was Vivian, and she helped me with all the forms I was trying to use to get a small discount on the room.  She went way out of the way to help, more than I am use to. The room was small but clean.  It gave me a good nights sleep.

After a lomng and busy week in L.A, I stopped here on my way to San Diego. Spent to night, got great nights of sleep. They have a nice pool and really easy to access to the highway. Small minus is to soft beds,.Many restauraunts near by. Rooms are "ok", internet works, TVs little bit outdated. All fine, four stars

I had to drive to swanky Laguna Beach everyday I was here but it was worth it for the price and the stay   The staff was a cordial team.  I arrived right around check in and there were two couples waiting in the lobby because the clerks were busy.  These guests proceeded to berate the clerks for making them wait a few minutes.  (They confided in me that they had just arrived before me but still laid into the staff).  Despite this, the two clerks resolutely weathered the abuse. When it was my turn it was all copacetic.  Just really friendly people.  I was impressed, I didn't need anything during my stay but the idea that this is the kind of person that I would have to call made it easy to relax here.  The food I bought here is not the best though and nothing is really walkable

Parking and the front entrance was awkward. I didn't know where to enter and which door was which. I didn't find the fridge until halfway through the day because it was in the bathroom. I turned on the ac but it would take forever for the room to get cool. Water would not drain when we took a shower and it was very slippery and i almost slipped a handful of times. Wouldn't come back here
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments and for staying at our hotel.  Please know that we will look into each of these issues to ensure they do not happen again.  We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you the next time you are in town.

Summary: I stay here on my business trip when traveling to Irvine.   Nice Clean Hotel with good service  Like all courtyard hotels, good food area with coffee/basic food.   Location is great as it's close to the highway and close to Irvine Spectrum

Summary Heading: Great property and very conveniently located
Summary: This property has great highway access as well as plenty of food choices close. The staff were all outstanding. The property, common areas and pool were very clean. My room was very clean, including the carpet, but there were noticeable permanent carpet stains and it needed replacement regardless of normal remodeling cycles. Definitely not up to Marriott standard, which is the only reason this is a "Very Good" instead of "Excellent" rating. I still highly recommend this property. I could have asked for a different room but I only had about 8 hours to spend at the hotel.

Doesn't measure up to Courtyard standards, particularly when it comes to customer service. Asked for a room with two beds and was given one bed and an uncomfortable sofa bed that didn't even come with sheets. (Had to ask for it to be made up when we arrived at 11 pm.) Ice machine on ground floor was broken. Then we were double-billed on credit card and am still pursuing that complaint.
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology for the issues you experienced during your stay.  I would like to ensure that your credit card issue has been resolved so please contact me directly.  Thank you very much for your valuable feedback and we look forward to better serving you the next time you are in town.

Summary: Love the Marriott Properties  Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.   Staff is friendly.  Cafe is perfect.  Coffee in the morning is a must.  I'll definitely stay here my next visit...... Conveniently located 20 minutes from the beach.

Summary Heading: Great staff! And a little surprising fact!
Summary: Very friendly staff at the front desk. My first time here but I could see regulars treated with fun and courtesy. Room was impeccably clean. I travel a lot and see a lot of "satisfactorily clean" rooms but this was exceptional. And (the surprise): when I went to turn on the shower, the shower head was pointed away from me toward the wall. One if my pet peeves is having that cold blast hit you because the housekeeper "aims" it outward. OK, sounds like a picky thing but in this business, it's those little things that count. Well done, Courtyard!

The Courtyard Laguna Hills is the perfect base to explore areas from Laguna Beach to San Juan Capistrano. All the usual Courtyard features. Clean, friendly staff, serviceable pool, etc. reasonable rates.  They do not disappoint. But the location is probably the best, lots of restaurants nearby and rt 5 is right there

Typically, Marriott brand hotels offer excellent comfort.  Unfortunately, I found the bed to be a bit too firm (woke up with a back ache 2 days in a row) and the couch I my king room was uncomfortable -- difficult to sit and watch TV without slouching against stiff cushions.  The shower head was old and in need of replacing, but the bathroom was large and clean with decent lighting.  The room overall was clean and the bathroom and bed were functional, just not comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize your stay did not meet your expectations. We hope that we have an opourtunity to better service you in the future when your travels bring you back to Laguna Hills.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel this past Saturday night on my way down to San Diego for the last day of Comic Con. Check in was smooth. The front area was modern looking and chic. My room was clean and stocked with nice toiletries. The pool was amazing! I've been in heated pools before but none as warm as this. After the pool, I enjoyed the spa. It was a just a quick trip away from Laguna Beach and the front desk person had printed out directions ready to go. Check out was just as smooth the next day. I will definitely stay here again. A++

Summary Heading: Room Not Cleaned Despite Call to Front Desk
Summary: I checked in for a two night stay with my husband on our way to San Diego. I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member and used two free night certificates. We went out at 10am this morning and returned at 4pm this afternoon and our room was not cleaned. I immediately called the front desk and the woman said "I'm sorry, we are slave driving our housekeepers I will make sure your room is taken care of" We went out to dinner and returned and our room has not been cleaned. I called the front desk again. The woman who answered offered to have towels sent up and add some points to my account. This property is run very poorly. Don't stay here if you can avoid it.
Manager Response: Please accept our most sincere apology for your room not being cleaned.  As a Marriott guest you should expect nothing less that excellent service and we are sorry we were not able to provide that for you.  We very much value your loyalty and we hope we can get a chance to earn back your business.  I left you a VM this morning so please call me back when convenient for you.

Summary: This was my second time staying at this location.  The staff is always friendly and the rooms are always clean.   They have a pool.  Starbucks is made to order on-site which is a huge bonus in my book.  The hotel is near the highway which makes it easily accessible to other areas.  The fitness room is relatively small, but that's my only complaint.  It can get hot in the room where the equipment is and there are only two treadmills, an elliptical, a bike, and a few free weights.  Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would definitely visit again.

I had business throughout SoCal over an 8-day period, so it made sense to situate myself in a location where I could access I-5 and beyond.  This was he place.  No frills, but it works.  Location:  there is a shopping mall a mile away.  CVS, Carl's Junior, and a bunch of fast food within about a 20-minute walk.  Access to north and south 5 is about a mile away.  I had access to toll toads to take me to Anaheim, San Bernardino, Laguna Nigel, and finally L.A.  Hotel:  being right off the 5, the exterior of the hotel is noisy, however the staff and the interior make up for it.  My room faced the opposite direction from the highway and it looked over parking and the back of another business.  They had a small restaurant and a few menu options for dining.  There is a bar on site.

Good location if you are doing business in this part of Los Angeles.  It is near the freeway and lots of restaurants and shopping.  Hotel has been remodeled to the new courtyard standard.  Food choices are small and weren't real appetizing.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for staying with us during your recent trip.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again soon.

Summary: I stayed for three nights.  Location is easy to I 5 with many eating places close by but not walking distance.  The property is in good condition and the rooms are good.  I did have stains on the carpet by the sink, rather ugly looking.  The room otherwise was clean and nice.  The Bistro is consistent with other properties.  It was odd for me but I was able to use the pool area for an hour this trip.  It was clean and nice and the lounge chair comfy.  They had clean towels out for use.  I even used the spa for a few minutes.  Request a room as far from the freeway as possible to reduce road noise.  Other nice thing, the windows open for fresh air.

Stayed here for business - nice pool and hot tub - nice little bar and breakfast nook - rooms are very clean and the rate was very reasonable - you can get to the beach in 15/20 minutes. They have some smaller conference rooms if you need a meeting space

Older hotel but recently updated with many new features and very nice. The staff was very kind and helpful. The lobby has a bistro area where all food is available for purchase. Sorry no free breakfast here. Elevator is very slow so try to get a room on the ground floor. At times the dish TV doesn't work very well especially if it's not good weather outside. Hotel is in a great location and very convenient right off the highway. It could be better with some mechanical updates like a faster elevator and some better furniture otherwise a great place to stay.

This hotel was adequate enough for a work trip.  It was very clean, inexpensive,  and the staff was nice and helpful.  The location literally overlooked the freeway though.  My room though overlooked a very ugly parking lot.  Food choices were very limited in the hotel,  nothing really in walking distance,  and lobby/bar area was pretty dead.  This may have been a VPN issue,  but I couldn't get Internet in my room,  so I had to work in the business center/lobby area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we apologize for the issues you experienced.  We are constantly looking for ways to improve our hotel and add value to our guests.  We hope to have a chance to serve you again the next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Clean & Spacious with a friendly staff!
Summary: I thought the rooms were very clean and spacious. There was no fee for parking and the hotel is located right off the 5 freeway. I had no trouble with noise though from it being located so close. The man that checked me in was very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel if you are in need of a hotel in the Laguna Hills area.

The hotel is right next to the freeway, so if you want to really relax in a nice quiet setting, forget it. My room smelled like a cross between dirty socks and mildew. I saw a customer bringing in a small little dog, which I thought courtyards do not allow. I saw dog poop in the parking lot which was cleaned up quickly. The staff didn't appear happy, because I wasn't greeted like other courtyards. I can't recommend this courtyard especially if motel 6 can do the job cheaper.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we apologize for the issues you experienced. Please know that we are looking into these issue to ensure they are corrected.  In addition we do not allow pets however, per ADA law, we do allow service animals in the hotel and guests must present papers verifing the animal.  We look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: Near the freeway. Close enough to the Irvine Spectrum Shopping Mall. The place is extremely clean, but the rooms are not that nice. Looks a little older. Staff is not the friendliest but nice enough. Really disliked how the "Check-In" Clerk is always outside smoking the moment their are no customers. It's just crazy as I've never experienced having to walk outside to ask the smoking clerk if I could buy things from the store. I feel it's bad business to have a clerk that smells like smoke in a non smoking hotel.
Manager Response: Please accept our most sincere apology for the issues you experienced during your stay.  Please know that we will be addressing the problems to ensure they do not occur again in the future. Thank you very much for your comments and we look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: I first thought it was should be really nice for price it charged. It's old building but renovated. Room kinda smelled funky. Tv position was off from bed. Parking is great. Location good no disturbances. Gr8 fir meeting and business purposes. Lobby is business oriented with cafe printer . Wifi in room . Wanted to give 3 and half star but can't here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Please know that we will be looking into these issues to ensure this was a one time occurance.  For furture refrence our TV's are on slides so that it can be viewed from any area in the room.  We look forwards to having the chance to serve you again soon.

Summary Heading: So who cleans the drawers then?
Summary: This was a nice hotel to stay at. The beds were comfortable, bathrooms were clean, hotel was quiet except for freeway noise (expected though when on a busy freeway), nice starbucks coffee for purchase downstairs, etc. My ONLY complaint though is when I was in my room looking for the fridge I came upon a drawer with clothes left behind. I called the front desk to inform them they told me "housekeeping doesn't clean the drawers".....I would think this would be part of the routine but I guess it's not. It makes me wonder what other cleaning procedures are omitted from this Courtyard's routine. Overall, nice hotel for a night or two.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments and for staying with us.  Our housekeepers should absolutly be cleaning the drawers and it is one of the items on their checklist, I apologize that you told differently.  Please know that I will be sharing your comments with our staff so that this does not happen again.

Summary Heading: Exactly What You Expect From a Courtyard Hotel
Summary: The hotel is freeway close for easy access with lots of free parking.  Check in was quick and easy.  We stayed in a king room on the 3rd floor.  It was a little small, but very clean and quiet.  The bed was very comfortable.  The sink was outside the bathroom so getting ready in the morning was great.  The bathroom was also extremely clean.  Wifi was free.  The hotel is not far from a shopping mall with a number of shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, we look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice Room #328 - Close To Many Restaurants
Summary: I enjoyed visiting this particular Courtyard by Marriott as I had a special rate and decided to get out of my apartment and hang with my OC buds. King Bed was splendid and the hotel grounds clean. The jacuzzi was nice and enjoyed the late check out per my MR Gold membership. Four Claws Up!!!! Gay friendly. Thanks fer reading my review. Joe the Bear - Redondo Beach, CA
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments.  We hope to see you the next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Met my needs very well and reasonably priced
Summary: I stayed at this Courtyard for 2 nights on a business trip.  Our office is near the Irvine Spectrum, but hotels in that area were over $300/night.  I got a very good deal on the Marriott website for this Courtyard for less than $200 each night.  Also, it was very easy to take surface roads to get to our office in Irvine and avoid the 405 at rush hour.  There is plenty of free parking.  The hotel is very close to the 405, so there is some road noise, at least there was in my room.  Check in was quick.  I was given a king bed room on the fourth floor.  It was a typical Courtyard room layout with the sink separate from the shower and commode.  There was a mini fridge and counter area across from the sink, where the closets usually are in Courtyard rooms.  A wardrobe was next to the
Manager Response: We very much appreciate your review of our hotel and we look forward to serving you again the next time business bring you to the area.

Summary: Stayed 2 nights. Room had mini-fridge and coffeemaker/counter area. Clean & comfortable.  Easy access from S 405, but inconvenient access to N 405.  No great restaurants nearby, but mall & Trader Joe's about 1.5 miles south via surface streets.  Check-in was quick.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us, we truly appreciate your business.

Summary: It a nice courtyard, the rooms were fresh and warm. The staff was great, and knew the area well. The only issue i had was there weren't many restaurants near by, you had to drive some way to find a good one. Otherwise, a good hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for yor comments.  We look forward to seeing you again soon

Summary: Very nice hotel, the area is not far from a few shopping centers but the hotel itself is a little isolated on the Avenida de la Carlotta. Needless to say it is very quiet. The rooms are very nice and there was a mini-fridge in our room with the King size bed. There was also a nice sized sofa bed which my son said was very comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again soon.

Summary: Very busy at check-in, but clerk was very professional and friendly.  We asked for and received a room away from the highway noise, which was a plus.Room was clean and well appointed, the bed and linens super comfy;gym was small but adequate for our needs.  Parking was not too convenient because you had to walk down the parking lot hill into traffic to access the sidewalk in front of the hotel..there were no side or back entrances.  Only disappointment was breakfast and the "Starbucks" coffee.  Eggs were overcooked & dry -- tasted like they were sitting under a heat lap for hours.  I reported my disappointment, and received an apology, but no offer to correct or compensate.    The coffee was terrible and so was the Barista... my husband picked it up and brought it to room which

If you've read any of my previous posts you will be able to quickly tell that I put a lot of emphasis on customer service. I stayed at this hotel as part of a youth soccer group, but the person from our group who made the reservations did not do an adequate job.  Upon check-in there was a lot of confusion, but Alex (at reception) eased the process as much as she possibly could.  She accommodated many of our requests to make room changes and changes for payment.  The customer service provided met my expectations of a Marriott property.  The hotel itself was nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The fitness center was small, but had the basics including free weights.  The pool area could have been kept up better (a family had left pool toys from the previous night and there

Stayed 3 days including a weekend.  Hotel review tripadvisor  The location was convenient to Orange County activities, right off the highway.  The hotel was easy to find. Checkin was quick and efficient. The room was clean and tidy.  There were plenty of electrical outlets.  Light switches were motion sensing.  Water pressure was good in shower.  The wifi was fast enough to watch videos with very little buffering.  Amenities were Paul Mitchell.  Breakfast setup was a pay for cafe that also served as a bar with light food in the evening. The in-room coffee is inside the cabinet.

Summary Heading: Great location - competitively priced - very nice hotel staff
Summary: Perfect location right off of the freeway and close to restaurants and shops.   Check in - easy, fast and accommodating Parking - Lots of parking close to entrances Rooms - Small, but clean. We had a couple of issues that were not deal breakers. Closet space - None. There was only a small armoire in the room which could not accommodate a long, formal dress. There was no other place to hang it.  We ran into each other every time one of us needed to go anywhere in the room. It's pretty small. The lotions/shampoo were used and gosh, at the very least, someone should have refilled them.  Other than that, the room was fine and quiet. Bed was comfy. Furniture could use a cleaning and update.  Nice lobby!  Would stay again.

This hotel is clean and friendly personnel. They have a bistro where you can grab a bite to eat in the AM.  Also they are open for a snack and drinks in the evening till 9:30.   The margarita flatbread is really tasty.  The Starbucks coffees in the AM are really good.  They have scones and bagels for the AM along with egg sandwiches.   It's right off the freeway at the 5 and 405 freeway at Lake Forest Drive.  So Ray access.     We stayed here when we went to the Pageant of the Masters so easy access to Laguna Beach area too.

Summary Heading: Pleasant and affordable for an expensive area!
Summary: This was one of the better priced hotels for what you get in the Laguna Hills area. Just off the freeway it's easy to find and close to some restaurants. Our room was quiet and nice. A little minimalist in design but I think this was the idea.  Didn't use the pool or restaurant/bar area or biz center but the whole setup was nice looking and seemed useful. The little food shop was helpful as we didn't check in until late and were able to buy good and wine.

This place is more budget than Marriot. I had a king size suite. The pictures are decieving; the couch is small and gives the illusion of a much larger room. I stayed for three nights. It was quiet. But I just couldn't seem to get comfortable on the bed. It seemed smaller than the last king I had at a regular marriot and not as plush. The pillows were not as nice either.  The room was clean, the staff efficient, and the room Though small did not seem cramped. The layout was such that everything worked well. I spent a lot of time in the office chair and the pull out desk which provided a good work space. I was disconcerted by a stain on the carpet as I entered the room, however it was dry and after the first day I just quit looking at it. The hotel was very close to the training

Summary Heading: You are on your own here but it was a good experience
Summary: The whole family met at this location and we occupied six rooms.  You are near the freeway but the rooms are well insulated from the freeway noise and from the noise from the rooms close to you.  You are the bellman here and we had a good time playing bellman.  The staff is bare minimum but were quite accommodating.  The rooms were clean.  The restaurant doubles as a lobby but worked fine for our group.  Not "stuffy" so ideal for families with kids.  A little drive to Laguna and the ocean.  We had a good time and will come again.

Summary Heading: Pretty standard, a little less than what I'd expect from the Marriott chain
Summary: We stayed here one night en route to Laguna beach for a wedding. The staff were very friendly upon arrival very late at night. Rooms were a bit dated and the walls were a bit thin. There was nothing terrible about the rooms or hotel, it was just a bit blah for the Marriott chain. I would have expected a little nicer for the name and price. Location was right off the highway and minutes away from the 'downtown area' of Laguna hills. Overall, an okay stay but I'd consider staying at  a cheaper hotel next time.

Summary Heading: Noisy. Front desk staff a little...weird
Summary: This is pretty much your standard Courtyard, and if it was your standard Courtyard, I'd give it 5 stars. But things were a bit off...mostly with the staff  1.) Check in took FOREVER. Normally, it takes less than 5 minutes. I think I was trying to check in for a good half hour, even though I was the only one there. The lady checking me in took her sweet time, fussing around with the computer, doing who-knows-what. This reservation was booked a good two months in advance, so I don't know what she was doing.  2.) Apparently, she did something because we ended up with the handicapped room. We do not need this, I did not ask for this (nor would I ever ask for this because what if someone truly needs this???). This is a problem because the bathroom is designed for someone in a
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, I apologize for the isses you experienced while at the hotel.  Please know that we are looking these issues to ensure they do not happen again.  We value your opinion and your business and we hope to have the chance you serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: what you expect from a courtyard marriott and in a convenient location
Summary: standard courtyard mariott hotell which to me is a good thing. Nice and clean lobby, helpful front desk staff and this one even had a bar /mini restaurant which was quite convenient (though definitely pricey).  Its right off the freeway which makes it convenient when heading back on the road though fwy noise is audible in some areas of hotel (though to me it wasnt bad).  There is nothing food wise walking distance from hotel, so plan on taking a short drive to go eat.  Pool and jacuzzi were fine, nothing fancy but clean and had plenty of clean towels so it worked for me.

There are several Courtyards in the general area.  I have found consistently that the Laguna Hills location has better pricing than those locations nearby. Although this is close to the freeway the noise level is acceptable and the proximity to the freeway is good for those that want quick access to attractions nearby. I recommend this location.

The hotel is updated and clean. The service was great and was very fast in the Bistro. The hotel is right off the highway and easy to locate. My only complaint is the the bathroom had a horrible sewer smell I am not sure if it was just the room but I did not smell it in the hall?  I really hope they get their plumbing checked out.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments, I wanted to let you know that this issues has been addressed.  We appreciate you letting us know so that we can correct it.  We look forward to seeing you again soon

Summary: Me and my husband travel with marriott a lot. But let me tell you, so far this is our favorite place to stay when we visit Irvine. The service is amazing, all the hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We will go back again I have to thank the front desk team specially Vivian who helped us a lot and the general manager Michael  Thank you Courtyard

There is not enough parking here. When we arrived at 3:00pm it was tough to find a parking spot. The staff was slow and the guests were obnoxious. I know the hotel can't help that, but we were in line with one person being helped in front of us for twenty minutes. I had pre-checked in and took 2 minutes to get my keys and leave the desk. The person being helped next to us put her foot up on the counter and was picking at ther toes and the staff did not even ask her politely to get her foot offf of the counter. The rooms were standard. Ours faced the freeway and you could hear the freeway noise some, but not too loud. There is a smoking area right outside the side door of the hotel so as soon as you walk out you have to hold your breath unless you want to inhale a bunch of smoke,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments.  Please now that we are looking into the issues you experienced in order to correct them moving forward.  We value your opinion and your business very much and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: I had a very helpful experience from the beginning when I entered the property. Vivian is such a sweetheart! She's so helpful, kind and positive. Asked for a preferred room ( was our 1st time here but have been to many other Marriotts). They didn't have but upgraded to a suite because of our Elite status we had the opportunity to and was grateful.  The property is not as modern as I hoped maybe because my bf and I have been spoiled with previous stays at our Marriotts- whether Residence Inn, full service Marriott, courtyards, etc.  It's pretty quiet when we were there as far as people noise. The suite we stayed at was comfortable and similar to the Courtyard Torrance as far as the setup. But it was a bit of a noise being near the freeway ( for those that appreciate quietness).
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and for staying with us.  Audra has spoken with our housekeeping manager to ensure we are correcting the issues you experienced.  We very much look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again soon.

Summary: Great hotel very clean and staff very accommodating. Pools okay nothing special but nice and clean. Irish pub in walking distance very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Beds and linen very comfortable rooms quiet. I would recommend a management changing AC units a little noisy but not bad

When visiting the Irvine area, I always book at this Courtyard because of it's convenience to the 405, dining and business area that I need to access.  I have stayed here 3 times.  Check-in is always easy and I usually get the type of room I request - a quiet location.  The beds here are so comfortable and I've never had a noise complaint/problem. The room amenities are quality items and the coffee in plentiful (housekeeping brings more if I want it too).  Parking is convenient and plentiful.    I will stop for drinks at the Bistro which can be nice after a long day and I don't feel like going out.  I usually skip the Bistro meals though - just not my type of menu.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for you kind words and for staying with us.   We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Fine Hotel but Skip the Bistro and Demand Better Environmental Policy
Summary: Our travel is for a memorial service in the area.  This location is convenient.  Others have mentioned the staff and I reiterate that the staff is first rate.  Our room is generous, clean and comfortable.  The Bistro flunks.  It is convenient, expensive, and the portions are tiny.  I expected convenient and expensive but my salad was so meager that I could see the small plate through the lettuce.    They haven't gotten the news that we have a water shortage.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments.  We do have a linen resuse program in place where you can have linens and towels replaced at your discretion.  I will make sure to review this policy with our team.  We also have installed low flow toilets and showerheads as well as rain and moisture detecting irrigation to ensure we are using as little water as possible.  We look forward to serving you again the next time you are in town.

Summary: I called to make a reservation. I was transferred to the reservation.  As I was telling her what room I wanted to book, I heard a CLICK. She HUNG UP.  OKAY, if that's how they do business, I will take my $$$ elsewhere.  There's plenty of other hotels around.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you were not able to make your reservation.  I will make sure to contact our reservation center to let them know about this incedent.

Summary: We originally were supposed to stay at the Fairfield Inn nearby but had a problem so we checked into here and this place was amazing! We got a room up on the 5th floor (Top Floor) facing the back which had an ok view but was still very nice. Everything about this hotel was nice and I recommend this hotel to anyone who stays in this area!
Manager Response: I am so glad we were able to help you out in your time of need.  Thank you for your review of our hote.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Wow, what a great vacation! I am so fortunate to have such amazing friends and was invited to go to Laguna Beach which I love. We stayed at the Courtyard Laguna Hills Irvine Spectrum which is about 20 minutes from Laguna Beach. I have to say that the Courtyard Team was simply, Amazing! I was greeted by Mary at the Front Reception who was Awesome. She greeted me with a smile, was very accommodating and professional and made me feel welcome from the start. The lobby is open and nicely decorated and has a counter to order breakfast and lunch with plenty of seating. We went down for breakfast the next day and Reem, who greeted us at the counter and took care of us was absolutely wonderful. Positive energy and a beautiful smile.  We spent the day in San Diego and when we came back
Manager Response: Keith, Thank you so much for your wonderful review and for shining the spotlight on our incredible staff.  We are pleased that we were able to make your stay enjoyable and memorable.  We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel.  We had a room block for our wedding (Sarah in special events is awesome!) and I don’t know if we were treated better than most because I was the bride but everyone was absolutely soooo nice and accommodating.  The hotel lobby and decor are modern.  Check in was a breeze with our check in guy being very friendly. Our bartender was also super friendly and efficient.  Our rooms were clean and spacious.  AC worked perfectly. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that their restaurant/bar closes too early.  They close at 10pm, which is a bit early for us.  But other than that, a fabulous stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words.  Everyone in your party was a pleasure to have in the hotel and you looked beautiful on your wedding day.  I am glad we were able to serve you on your special day.

Summary Heading: One of the better hotels in the area
Summary: Have stayed at a few hotels in the area, and this is one of the better ones located of the 5 freeway. It's a lot more expensive than other hotels in the area and does not include breakfast. Room and bed were comfortable and a very short walk or drive to some places to eat if your hungry. I would consider this hotel again depending on the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and for staying with us.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: location is good as it is close to freeway. However, that also means highway noise if you are on that side of hotel. Pool is good. People are great. On premise market is helpful if you choose to stay in your room. Central lobby has a welcoming feel with plenty of open group areas and booths to be more private.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments.  Please think of us again the next time you are in the area.

Summary: I made reservations to stay here well in advance and called to confirm. I got in pretty late as I said I would. I show up at 1am with my 4 kids only to find out they didn't have my room. The person working that night said don't worry I have a great room for you. I was still upset but figured after a 5hr drive I'll take it. I walk in to realize he gave me "the conference room" with a tiny single bed and a huge 12seat conference table. At this point I'm so upset and call the front desk, letting him know this isn't going to work. I argued my reservation and his respond is "we are not obligated to keep reservations" after I argue back and forth he says to me" what are you going to do? You want to check out?" He says I've called in a favor at a near by hotel and you can go there. I

Summary Heading: Dirty room, so much road noise I might as well be sleeping right on the 405
Summary: Stayed here 1 night for business, would never stay here again.  Carpets dirty & stained, someone else's hair all over bathroom floor, half-finished beverages left in the room by housekeeping.  Noise from the 405 so loud I couldn't sleep.  Stay anywhere else but here.  Expensive and awful.
Manager Response: Please accept my most sincere apology for the the experience you had while staying at our hotel.  I have met with my team to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  Again I apologize and I hope we get a chance to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice visit to Laguna HIlls Area
Summary: Good location close (by car) to Panera's and other restaurants.  Staff was attentive.  The breakfast and dinner setup with Starbucks coffee served was quite handy.  The pantry / mini store by the front desk stocks most of the things you may need in a pinch..snack, drink aspirin etc..  Pool and sun area is secluded and comfortable.  Work out area is available 24hrs/day. Now for the other side....The  WIFI setup in the room and public areas was for me VERY disappointing.  Even paying for premium service the lag and number of disconnects was disturbing.  The only reason this property didn't get a 5 star rating is the far below average performance of the Internet connection.  There was no provision for plugging directly into an ethernet connection to offset with the poor wireless

Summary Heading: An average Courtyard; Not so easy on to freeway North (etc)
Summary: Average for a Courtyard. Getting back on the freeway North legally isn't easy; there's no U-turn to get onto the on-ramp. My room had stained carpet, which they tried to deal with, unsuccessfully, after I informed them of it (and a stained ironing board cover that they replaced). However, that said, in general the rooms are nice (& clean otherwise), the staff is fine/nice, the Bistro was fast in the morning for oatmeal, and for the area the value is OK.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and for staying with us.  Please know that we have shared your comments with the appropriate staff to ensure these issues do not arise in the future.  We hope to see you on your next trip to the area.

Summary: Make it sound its right next to the Spectrum.  Such is not the case. Rooms are very small and not very private.  The walls are paper thin and u can literally here the conversations of people in adjoining rooms. I was very displeased with our location.  Had a wonderful view of the roof top and air conditioning.   All in all I have stayed at Comfort Inns better than this.  Not worth over $100.00 and I had the friends and family rate. Thinking about canceling my Marriott reward s card. Because frankly I have not been satisfied with the Marriotts I've. stayed in.
Manager Response: We apologize for the issues you experienced while staying at our hotel.  Please know that we take all guest comments very seriously and we will be taking steps to correct these issues.  Thank you very much for your comments.

Summary: I have stayed at this location many times when traveling to southern California. Not far from the Orange County Airport (John Wayne). Hotel has been recently updated, including the addition of  a limited bistro for salads, sandwiches & coffee. Quiet and comfortable. Easy access to I-405. Internet access works quite well (reasonable upload & download speed) to accomplish work.

Loved the location of this hotel near the 405, very quiet.  Felt like we were one of the only people in the hotel!  The lobby is very contemporary and updated recently.  Purchased breakfast from the Bistro two mornings as soon as they opened (at 7 a.m.) and was able to take it back to the room - Starbucks, fresh fruit, toasted bagels - everything was just fine.  Great service.  Booked through Expedia and got a great price.  I will definitely recommend this hotel to colleagues as we frequently travel to the Laguna Hills area to do business.
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: What more can I say about a new Courtyard.  Excellent staff and very clean.  Took family and in-law's to this location.  It was a perfect choice.  Great central location for all of the places we wanted to go to.  Quite area and easy parking.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for your kind words about the hotel.  We look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary Heading: Pretty good stay except for the Bistro
Summary: Excellent location off of 405.  Room was nice and big and a great comfortable bed, very clean with good selection of morning coffee items.  Everything worked well, except we did have problems with the free wifi in our room (but the hotel is big so distance may have been a problem).  We noticed wind noise coming from the windows, however there was a note in the room that the hotel was replacing all the windows with new energy efficient and noise reduction ones.  The freeway noise really didn't bother us because it was more like white noise, which will probably go away with new windows.    My only disappointment was with the Bistro dining (I stay at many Courtyards so I'm very familiar with their breakfasts).  When you order the $10 egg breakfast (the most expensive item) you
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Please know that I will be follwing up with our Bistro staff regarding proper service and food presentation.

Summary: This new hotel is one of my favorite Courtyards anywhere!  Perfect for business travelers! The hotel is very modern, and beautifully designed. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Free Wi-Fi, coffee maker, and fridge in every room. Great work space and comfortable chair. I spend alot of time working in my room, so a comfortable work space environment is very important to me. The bathroom was very clean, spacious and well-laid out. I loved that the lobby was very large and offered a lot of seating. The breakfast was very good. I stayed at a more expensive hotel on my previous visit and this property was less expensive and in my opinion, a much nicer hotel. The staff was excellent and customer service was top notch.    My only complaint, which is the same for all of the

Well laid out, nicely designed and furnished.  Located very close to the Irvine Spectrum Center.  The rooms are nicely done.  The hotel seems perfect for business travelers.  Only disappointment is that my room only had a shower, no bath and after a long hard day on my feet, I would at least like the option.  A little pricey for a Courtyard brand when there are several Marriott properties within a few miles for the same price (or $10 more).  Also a little surprised that they charge for parking at this location.

Nice----if you grew up thinking you were Sanford & Sons.  TV remote would only change volume...not channels. I figured something was wrong, so I called the front desk. Right away, she knew what the problem was, and told me to unplug the TV, leave it unplugged for 10 seconds, and then plug it back in. It worked!  If it's that damn easy, start earlier, & fix it.  If you like Sanford and Son's, this is the hotel for you. If you like luxury, or even a decent place, then this is not even close!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for your comments.  Please know that we are looking into the issue with the remotes and will make sure that this does not continue.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: I stayed two separate nights in two different rooms, as I was traveling through So Cal and Mexico. Both rooms appeared to be newly renovated, very nice, clean and comfortable. The lobby also appeared to be new and modern as another reviewer mentioned. I like the location of this property as well, close to freeways, shopping, restaurants, etc. The nightly rate may not be as cheap as some other nearby stays like the Laguna Hills Lodge, but it's a nicer hotel and I'd recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your business and for your review of the hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We just spent 2 nights here last weekend and were pleased we had not taken the advice to stay in Costa Mesa.  The location of this hotel was perfect for heading down Hwy 133 to Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, and Balboa Island, as well as for access to shopping, movies, and places to dine right there in Irvine.  The rooms were nicely furnished, updated, and spacious.  Our room faced the back parking lot so there was no freeway noise.  With no parking fee and free WiFi, it was great for the value as compared to other hotels close by.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words about out hotel.  We look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: Settled in a nice area, with good quick food choices near, we found this to be a really good stay. The rooms were clean and new with everything stocked and working. The family enjoyed the pool and it was nice to be in a place where most of the guests are there for business (it was quiet). Quick access to freeways was a bonus, but overall it's a really good place to rest as you go out/on to other fun things in California.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us.  We are happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to seeing you the next time you are in town.

Summary: I am a "Marriott Girl" I always stay at Marriott properties. This was so disappointing. The property in General was dirty, the elevator and hallways and in my room there was a huge stain on the carpet and behind the head of my mattress it looked like someone had spilled coffee or "something" and no one cleaned it. My ceiling was sagging and the drywall seam looked like it was going to split any time.
Manager Response: I am so sorry for the experience you had while at our hotel.  Please know that we are reviewing your comments to ensure that this does not happen again.  We appreciate your loyalty to Marriott and we would very much like the opportunity to regain your trust.

Summary Heading: Decent stay, but some minor issues
Summary: The hotel was, in general, clean and in decent condition. The lobby must have recently had a makeover because it had a more modern feel than the rest of the hotel. The room, on the other hand, showed its age. It had a popcorn ceiling and the A/C was a wall mounted kind that had to be on all the time to keep the room cool. It was very loud and I had to use earplugs to sleep.  The lobby has a mini restaurant that served small meals and coffee, but there was no free breakfast.  Our room basically overlooked I-5, so the noise from the freeway could be heard. On the bright side, I could tell how busy the 5 was just by looking out my window.  The rate was low, so I guess I'd recommend it based on the price, but just realize it's an OK hotel that probably could use a makeover of the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for your comments.  You will be happy to know that we are currently in the process of replacing all of our AC units with new, quieter, more efficient units.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Stay at this hotel more night than at home. I really enjoy staying there, they are the best in the area. The front desk staff is awesome particularly Caroline who always makes me feel at home! Located close to good restaurants. and is very convenient to where I am working.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and for choosing our hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: After flying all day from New York I was greeted by Denise at the front desk who could not do enough for me.  She recommended several restaurants and gave me step by step instructions to walk to a local restaurant   Since Denise was running the front desk, Caroline offered to drive me to the restaurant.  I refused at first, but she would not have it.  She called the restaurant and discovered they were closed for renovations, but found another place and drove me the restaurant and offered to come back and pick me up.  Their commitment to the customer was truly outstanding.  I highly recommend the Marriott a Laguna Hills!!!  Denise and Caroline, I appreciate your help, appreciate your charming smiles and willingness to serve the customer!!!
Manager Response: Than you for your comments regarding Denisse and Caroline.  They are both great associates and I am glad they were able to meet and exceed your expectations.  Please come back and see us the next time you are in town.

Summary Heading: Good hotel with friendly staff,  but food options are extremely limited.
Summary: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while visiting nearby family. I had the impression that the hotel was nowhere near full while I was there. The attractive restaurant area and lobby were generally empty.  The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I was happy with the room and enjoyed the pool.  The main drawbacks were the extremely limited menu at the restaurant and rather isolated location with no restaurants or shops within walking distance. The rate I paid was reasonable except for the last night (a monday night), for which I somehow had to pay a rather exorbitant sum considering the location and amenities.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing our hotel and for your kind words about our staff.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Had a great experience, very clean, nice decor, great breakfast but most of all excellent staff! The general manager was kind enough to even book my next stay for next month. Offered nice perks and was very responsive. Thanks Marc!
Manager Response: It's my pleasure to assist you.  Thank you for choosing our hotel and we look forward to seeing you in a couple of weeks.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here last week on business for three nights.  Since I am Lifetime Platinum Elite, upon check in I politely inquired if a continental breakfast was included, which some Courtyards offer as a perk. Well!!  The young female manager proceeded to lecture me including quoting Bill Marriott himself, about never giving out breakfasts as "the more you give them, the more they want.  They have a choice of other hotels to stay at if they so chose."  We certainly do have a choice but were too exhausted from traveling to leave.  Her rant and seminar left me physically shaken and it did no good for my disabled husband. The upside was a front desk clerk named Gary,who was a sweetheart the entire stay and really should be hired to replace her.    The first room was right
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking time to speak with me today regarding your experience.

Summary Heading: Good nights sleep but had one issue
Summary: This hotel is your standard Courtyard.  However, since I am an elite member, I was upgraded to their corner room that is a one bedroom suite.  The lobby area has been renovated to meet the new Courtyard standards.    The issue I had was I left my Bluetooth headset in the room when I checked out.  I called the next evening when I realized I left my headset to see if it was found.  I called back on Monday and was told my headset was not found.  I know for a fact, I left it on the lamp stand next to the couch, but somehow it was not found.    I guess it is partly my fault, but this is not the first time I have stayed at a Marriott and left a Bluetooth headset behind that was not found.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our hotel.  Please know that I have passed along your comments about your bluetooth to our lost and found.  They are looking again through their items and we will contact you back if the until is found.

Summary: This hotel was a bad experience before I could even check in.  I booked it on line and made my reservation under the Federal Government rate which according to Marriott policy, covers active duty military and their dependents on leisure travel.  Upon check in the manager was looking over the clerks shoulder as we checked in and proceeded to take my military dependent ID, look it over, then tell me I did not qualify for the rate.  She sat there at 9pm arguing with me while my children stood and watched and waited to get in the room after a long day of cross country travel.  The manager continued to argue with me and was downright rude before finally letting me have the rate.  I would have left if not for my tired children.  I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and will warn
Manager Response: Dear Wendy,  I am so sorry for the experience that you had while at our hotel.  Please know that we have both active and retired military associates on our staff and we are very proud of that.  I would very much appreciate it if you could call me directly so that we can discuss this personally and to also go over Marriott's policy regarding the eligability for use of the government rate.  I look forward to speaking with you and to getting this issue corrected to your satisfaction.

Summary: A nice stay considering the cost of the room in the area you are in.  If you have a car, and are ok with driving 10-15 mins to get to where ever you need to get to, it is perfect.  It's not a hotel that you would have a romantic stay at, but I assume that's obvious if you are at a Courtyard Marriott.  Price is the key factor for satisfaction here.  Smaller room but recently updated in that Courtyard Marriott fashion.  Can't complain, when the parking and internet is free this close to Irvine, Costa Mesa, and Laguna Hills.  One downside is location right off of the freeway.  Ask for a room facing away from the freeway.  The 5 freeway can get noisy at times.  I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing our hotel and for your comments.  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip.

Summary: I tried to stay at this property. When I checked in, the room wasn't clean. I was offered a second, and then third room. These weren't up to standard either. I was upset with the poor housekeeping. I then requested to checkout, and cancel my stay. The hotel refused to refund me for the night, even though I didn't spend the night! There are no managers on the property on the weekends or during the evening hours. If a problem occurs, you are left to deal with a front desk employee.  I spoke to the General Manager on the next available business day. He mentioned that he went to check the rooms (two days later after it was obviously cleaned!) and didn't find anything. Apparently that means that I was wrong. I'm a platinum member with Marriott and this was an upsetting experience.

We spent two nights at the Courtyard over the Thanksgiving weekend.  The last time we were at this hotel, the first floor was undergoing a complete renovation and it was a real mess.  The lobby area is now complete and very nice!!  There are computers for guest use and a café, with lots of seating if you just want to hang out.  Our room was very nice and extremely clean.  We had a two room suite that was very comfortable with a tv in each room.  The internet worked great.
